text: today in my long list of Mexican
inspired breakfasts that I love I'm
making a corn tortilla and egg scramble
to start off with you try your corn
tortillas cut into strips or small
pieces in a few tablespoons of vegetable
oil it's about three tablespoons of oil
they really can be however you want
whatever size pieces you want
I just cut mine into strips six corn
tortillas just gonna go ahead and put
them all in there and then you can cook
them stirring until everything turns
golden and they should crisp up quite
quickly and then you can just transfer
them as they crisp to paper towels what
I love about this dish is the contrast
with the crispy crunchy fried tortillas
with the soft eggs and spicy poblanos
and onions and subs you're not gonna
need all this oil to cook your onions in
your poblanos so you can pour off most
of it leave like a tablespoon in the pan
be careful I'm one white onion diced and
one poblanos dice you want to cook this
until the onions are translucent and the
poblano softens that should take about
five minutes while you're waiting you
can dice up a tomato one medium tomato
move the core and then dice it up you
can also whisk your eggs I'm using eight
eggs
season with salt and pepper at this
point I think the onions and the
poblanos will be nice and softened add
your tomatoes I like to make sure I get
all the juice off the board a lot of
flavor in that juice give it a stir cook
it until the tomatoes softens a little
bit that should take about three minutes
I like to cook some of the moisture out
of my tomato before I add eggs to it
because I feel like once you add the
eggs if the tomatoes aren't cooked they
release their water into the eggs and
the eggs get all watery the tomatoes
have softened nicely and there's no
liquid in the pan so I'm going to add my
eggs
as well as half a cup of grated cheddar
cheese and in just a minute I'm gonna
add my tortillas you can add them now if
you want to but I want them to remain
pretty crunchy eggs shouldn't take more
than about three minutes to cook this is
a very colorful and full of vegetables
which is really great now you can add
your corn tortillas in I'm not gonna add
all of mine I'm gonna put some and then
I'll put some on top you can crumble
them just a little bit more especially
the ones that are going inside stir them
into your eggs so you get that contrast
I was talking about of the crunchiness
and the softness of the eggs as always
turn your eggs off before you think that
they're gonna be done because there's
gonna be some carryover cooking and if
you cook them too all the way done
they're gonna be way overcooked by the
time you get to eating them nice big
scoop with some of those crunchy bits
and some of that creamy egg a little bit
of hot sauce or a lot some crispy crunch
ease on top a breakfast like that makes
me super duper happy
you
